item.title: Sean add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "As I approached my fiftieth birthday, I had become more and more enraged and mystified by the idiot decisions made by my countrymen. And then I had come suddenly to pity them, for I understood how innocent and natural it was for them to behave so abominably, and with such abominable results: They were doing their best to live like people invented in story books. This was the reason Americans shot each other so often: It was a convenient literary device for ending short stories and books. Why were so many Americans treated by their government as though their lives were as disposable as paper facial tis-sues? Because that was the way authors customarily treated bit-part players in their made-up tales. And so on.Once I understood what was making America such a dangerous, unhappy nation of people who had nothing to do with real life, I resolved to shun storytelling. I would write about life. Every person would be exactly as important as any other. All facts would also be given equal weightiness. Nothing would be left out. Let others bring order to chaos. I would bring chaos to order, instead, which I think I have done. If all writers would do that, then perhaps citizens not in the literary trades will understand that there is no order in the world around us, that we must adapt ourselves to the requirements of chaos instead. It is hard to adapt to chaos, but it can be done. I am living proof of that: It can be done." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Sean add a quote by jean cocteau
item.description: "Art produces ugly things which frequently become more beautiful with time. Fashion, on the other hand, produces beautiful things which always become ugly with time." -- jean cocteau

item.title: Sean add a quote by Angela Carter
item.description: "I will tell you what Jeanne was like. She was like a piano in a country where everyone has had their hands cut off." -- Angela Carter

item.title: Sean add a quote by Audre Lorde
item.description: "If I didn't define myself for myself, I would be crunched into other people's fantasies for me and eaten alive." -- Audre Lorde

item.title: Sean add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "Painting is poetry that is seen rather than felt, and poetry is painting that is felt rather than seen." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: Sean add a quote by Samuel Beckett
item.description: "We are all born mad. Some remain so." -- Samuel Beckett

item.title: Sean add a quote by e.e. cummings
item.description: "Whenever you think or you believe or you know, you're a lot of other people: but the moment you feel, you're nobody-but-yourself." -- e.e. cummings

item.title: Sean add a quote by Arthur C. Clarke
item.description: "The only way of discovering the limits of the possible is to venture a little way past them into the impossible." -- Arthur C. Clarke

item.title: Sean add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "Just for the record, the weather today is calm and sunny, but the air is full of bullshit." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Sean add a quote by Lloyd Alexander
item.description: "Fantasy is hardly an escape from reality. It's a way of understanding it." -- Lloyd Alexander

item.title: Sean add a quote by Vladimir Nabokov
item.description: "You can always count on a murderer for a fancy prose style." -- Vladimir Nabokov

item.title: Sean add a quote by Umberto Eco
item.description: "Sometimes I look a the Moon, and I imagine that those darker spots are caverns, cities, islands, and the places that shine are those where the sea catches the light of the sun like the glass of a mirror...I would like to tell of war and friendship among the various parts of the body, the arms that do battle with the feet, and the veins that make love with the arteries or the bones with the marrow. All the stories I would like to write persecute me when I am in my chamber, it seems as if they are all around me, the little devils, and while one tugs at my ear, another tweaks my nose, and each says to me, 'Sir, write me, I am beautiful'." -- Umberto Eco

item.title: Sean add a quote by Ryunosuke Akutagawa
item.description: "A man sometimes devotes his life to a desire which he is not sure will ever be fulfilled. Those who laugh at this folly are, after all, no more than mere spectators of life." -- Ryunosuke Akutagawa

item.title: Sean add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "Many a book is like a key to unknown chambers within the castle of one’s own self." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Sean add a quote by William S. Burroughs
item.description: "Nobody owns life, but anyone who can pick up a frying pan owns death." -- William S. Burroughs

item.title: Sean add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "A man who procrastinates in his choosing will inevitably have his choice made for him by circumstance." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Sean add a quote by Clive Barker
item.description:
"I dreamed I spoke in another's language, I dreamed I lived in another's skin, I dreamed I was my own beloved, I dreamed I was a tiger's kin.
I dreamed that Eden lived inside me, And when I breathed a garden came, I dreamed I knew all of Creation, I dreamed I knew the Creator's name.
I dreamed--and this dream was the finest-- That all I dreamed was real and true, And we would live in joy forever, You in me, and me in you." -- Clive Barker

item.title: Sean add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "Maybe this world is another planet’s hell." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Sean add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "The reasonable man adapts himself to the world: the unreasonable one persists in trying to adapt the world to himself. Therefore all progress depends on the unreasonable man." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Sean add a quote by Martin Amis
item.description: "Love is an abstract noun, something nebulous. And yet love turns out to be the only part of us that is solid, as the world turns upside down and the screen goes black." -- Martin Amis

item.title: Sean add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "I learn a great deal by merely observing you, and letting you talk as long as you please, and taking note of what you do not say." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Sean add a quote by Werner Herzog
item.description: "Academia is the death of cinema. It is the very opposite of passion. Film is not the art of scholars, but of illiterates." -- Werner Herzog

item.title: Sean add a quote by Carl Sagan
item.description: "Every one of us is, in the cosmic perspective, precious. If a human disagrees with you, let him live. In a hundred billion galaxies, you will not find another." -- Carl Sagan

item.title: Sean add a quote by Nick Cave
item.description: "Music is storming, driving, relentless, devotional, slinky, subtle, heartbreakingly-beautiful sounds that, lyrically, switch from the cynical to the sanguine, the defeated to the defiant, dealing in love, war, beauty, children, romance, rejection, Pethedine, poetry, panties, God, Auden, Johnny Cash, cold potatoes, too-much-money, not enough money, writer’s block, flowers, animals and more flowers. But maybe I’m projecting here." -- Nick Cave

item.title: Sean add a quote by Gustave Flaubert
item.description: "Human speech is like a cracked kettle on which we tap crude rhythms for bears to dance to, while we long to make music that will melt the stars." -- Gustave Flaubert

item.title: Sean add a quote by William S. Burroughs
item.description: "I began to get a feeling (...) of being the only sane man in a nut house. It doesn't make you feel superior but depressed and scared, because there is nobody you can contact." -- William S. Burroughs

item.title: Sean add a quote by Ezra Pound
item.description: "Literature is news that stays news." -- Ezra Pound

item.title: Sean add a quote by Jarod Kintz
item.description: "Beer has that Olympic medal color,” Rot replied, “but does it have a winning taste? I’d hardly call silver a champion flavor. No, I’ll stick to my red wine.” " -- Jarod Kintz

item.title: Sean add a quote by H.P. Lovecraft
item.description: "Pleasure to me is wonder—the unexplored, the unexpected, the thing that is hidden and the changeless thing that lurks behind superficial mutability." -- H.P. Lovecraft

item.title: Sean add a quote by Barry Gifford
item.description: "In the picture, Ava Gardner's tousled black hair obscured her right eye, and her full, closed lips were pulled slightly to the right, resulting in something less than a smile. They looked as if they'd been smeared shut with red paint, though the photo was in black and white. It wasn't so much a fuck-me face as a I've-been-there-and-back look, the kind of expression you see only on the most expensive whores." -- Barry Gifford
